subject: Self Care
title: Happiness Myths Debunked
description: A fast breakdown of Happiness Myths Debunked for builders.

hook.text: 'I'll be happy when I get the promotion.' He got it. He wasn't. The 'when-then' trap is the oldest happiness lie.

buildup.text: Common myths: happiness is a destination, successful people are happier, and negative emotions must be eliminated.

discovery.text: Research shows happiness causes success, not the other way around. Happy people perform better, earn more, and live longer.

twist.text: Trying to be happy all the time actually backfires. The pressure to feel positive creates anxiety about negative feelings.

climax.text: Accept all emotions. Pursue meaning, not constant joy. A rich life includes sadness, frustration, and wonder side by side.

punchline.text: Happiness isn't a destination. It's a byproduct of meaningful living.
